Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
That sounds bad. Everyone ready, we must defend!
@BATTLE
Steady as she goes. This is a good course for our approach to the harbor.
Mahan, did you hear me?
Oh? Yes! Sorry.
Steady as she goes. Aye aye, Captain.
Focus, Mahan. We have a lot of civilian traffic out here. Let's not hit anyone.
*sigh* I know. I just don't want to see him go.
Mr. Holtman can't stay on board with us forever, Mahan. We have to drop him off today.
It was so great having such a brilliant thinker on board, someone who could talk to about tactics and strategy and, well... everything!

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad you enjoyed his visit. It sounds like you learned a lot.
That's nice, but the sooner he's gone, the better. We have a war to fight.
Well, you can always talk to me about things, too. I am your captain, after all.

Fields.DialogueText: I did! My head feels like it's full of great new ideas.
I know, but I'm still sad to see him go.
Oh! I'm sorry, Captain. I didn't mean to insult you.
Command needs us back at sea. Once we're there, you can put all of that new knowledge into practice.
We're almost at the harbor. Do you mind if I head down and say goodbye?
No problem, but don't take too long. Once he's safely on the pier, I need you back in the bridge.
Yes, Captain! I just need enough time for him to sign this book before he goes. I'll be right back!
Mahan!
Yes, Captain?
You left your book up here.
Right... thanks!
*sigh*
Heh, you didn't. Don't worry about it.
Reporting as ordered, Captain.
Have a look at these charts.
An easterly track across the Atlantic?
That's right.
A textbook transit from here to Portugal. It looks like it's plotted as a great circle route to save time and fuel.
Exactly. We're heading east, so I wanted you to study the battlefield.
Technically it's an ocean, not a field.

Fields.MenuText: You've always had an eye for details.
Should we call it a "battle ocean"?
It's just a figure of speech, Mahan.

Fields.DialogueText: An ear, you mean?
Hee hee! Point taken, Captain. "Battlefield" it is.
Of course. Sorry, Captain. You were saying?
Either way, this is where we have to be ready to fight.
I understand.
You're my tactical expert, so get us ready. We run a good chance of seeing some Morganas on our way to Spain.
Correct, Captain. According to the latest combat reports, that chance is approximately 100 percent.
Review your new tactics and make sure we're ready.
Studying tactics is what I do best, Captain. I'll get started right away.
Don't get lost in the books for too long. Morganas could show up at–
*ALARM*
...any time.
@BATTLE
Thanks for the training notes, Mahan. I'll make sure the other officers study these right away.
Great, thanks so much for the help. See you tomorrow!
See you then.
I'm impressed, Mahan.
Captain?
You've become more assertive about dealing with the officers on board.
Ah! Thank you, Captain. I appreciate that. McNamara has helped a lot, in that respect.

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad you're enjoying it.
I'm eager to see results.
You two do spend a lot of time together...

Fields.DialogueText: I'm really coming into my own, don't you think?
You can count on me, Captain!
I-I'm not sure what you're implying.
With all of these Morgana patrols, we'll need our officers to be as prepared as possible if we want to survive.
I'll do my best to prepare us.
@BATTLE
...Nothing at all, Mahan.
*ALARM*
Nice work yesterday, Mahan. You did a great job seeing us through that last skirmish with the Morganas.
Thank you, Captain.
It looks like your training is making us more effective.
The officers are more deliberate with their gunfire, just like I've been teaching them.
How so?
They used to waste a lot of ammunition by shooting as soon as they saw a Morgana. Now they wait until we're in a good firing position.

Fields.MenuText: Then it sounds like we're ready.
That can be helpful sometimes, but they need to use more judgment.
God help our ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Ready for what, exactly?
I agree. What do you propose we do?
I'm not sure it's that bad... I hope.
Just bring me the after-action report. I have an idea.
Aye aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
You called for me, Captain?
I did. Have a seat, because I have some big news for you.
That makes me nervous.
I hope I'm not the one making you nervous.
No!
Really? You could have fooled me.
I mean, no, Captain. I think I'll just stand if that's all right.
That's fine.
Command needs someone to lead a small task force. I volunteered us to lead it.
*gulp* You did what?!
With all of your tactical expertise, you're the best Belle for the job.
Me? Coordinating a whole task force? I don't know...

Fields.MenuText: Have some confidence. Besides, I'll always be here to help you.
Is it too much for you to handle? I don't want to disappoint Command.
Really? I thought you'd be eager to show off your knowledge of naval tactics.

Fields.DialogueText: I... I guess so.
And I don't want to disappoint you, Captain.
I am, but maybe in a classroom?
We have a war to win. It's time to put all of your reading and studying into practice.
I appreciate the faith you're putting in my abilities, Captain.
You're an amazing Belle, so I know you'll be ready before we get to Portugal. That's where we'll meet the rest of the task force.
I hope I'll be ready in time. I'll probably need...
Need what?
More books! I must have books to start preparing right now.
*ALARM*
Looks like it will have to wait, Mahan.
Ugh!
@BATTLE
*groan*
Mahan? Are you feeling all right? I'm starting to worry about you.
I am... fine, Captain.
You don't look fine. You've been pacing up and down the passageway for almost half an hour, muttering and making moaning sounds.
My head... My head...

Fields.MenuText: Anxious about working with the task force?
Take a bad hit in the last combat?
Forget your morning coffee?

Fields.DialogueText: No, it's worse than that...
No, it's worse than that...
No, it's worse than that...
Mahan? You're actually scaring me now.
I need a NEWSPAPER!
What?!
Oh, Captain, I'm so sorry for yelling, but we haven't gotten any newspapers since we left New York. Not having my daily paper is making my brain hurt!
You had me scared. I thought it was something serious.
This is serious! I can't concentrate! I need a newspaper to relax.
Maybe one of the crew has an old paper that you didn't read yet. I'll find one for you.
Thanks, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Mahan, I have something for you. This is the order of battle for our task force.
A listing of all the ships we'll be working with?
Yes. Here you go.
Thanks, Captain. And now, I have something for you.
What is it?
It's a logistics request. I need a few more supplies before we get started.
Oh. Here, let me just sign that.
There you go. Request approved.
You didn't even read it.

Fields.MenuText: I trust you. Just a few office supplies, right? Get this to the yeoman and send it out.
If you think we need it, then we need it. You're the ship, you know yourself better than we do.
Eh, the Navy will cover the cost. Anything's fine with me.

Fields.DialogueText: ...Thanks, Captain. I'll take care of it right away.
I hadn't seen it like that...
That's oddly laid back of you.
Once you're free, I want you reviewing that order of battle. We're going to need our tactical expert Belle to lead us.
Aye aye, Captain.
For now, we have Morganas to get rid of!
@BATTLE
Mahan, get up here to the bridge immediately!
Coming!
Reporting as ordered, Captain. What is it?
See that rusty cargo ship sneaking up on us from astern?
Sneaking up? No, Captain. That cargo ship is just here to deliver my supplies.
A few pens and pencils? One of the task force ships should have our delivery.
The order was too big for that. They sent that cargo ship to help out.
It's only a few crates. Forty typewriters and three hundred reams of paper. I can see the crates on her deck from here.
What?
Would you like to use my binoculars?

Fields.MenuText: No. I can see the problem clearly from here.
Yes. I need them to look for your common sense. It fell overboard somewhere.
Forty typewriters?! What are you going to do with forty typewriters?!

Fields.DialogueText: What problem?
Oh, Captain...
I was going to enlist the help of the officers to assist in typing up all of my battle plans for the task force, Captain.
We don't need all of that. It's far too much.
I just wanted to make sure I was prepared.
I know, I know.
...I should have read that logistics request before signing it.
I'm really sorry, Captain.
Let's take just two extra typewriters and some paper, and then get moving.
I'll hurry. I get the feeling that a few Morganas might be showing up soon.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
These pieces... Such colors... How exquisite...
Mahan? Are you in my cabin?
Yikes! You startled me!
I startled you? You're the one who's in someone else's room right now!
Oh! Captain, I can explain!

Fields.MenuText: I didn't expect to find you in here.
Were you going through my things?
Find something you like?

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't mean to surprise you.
No! I mean, yes... but I mean... I didn't mean to!
Haha... ha...
Relax, Mahan. I was going to show you that chess set later today, anyway. Looks like you found it early.
Your door was ajar when I walked by, and I saw it sitting on your table. The dark wood is so beautiful.
An antique. I bought it from one of the merchants when we took on supplies at Lisbon.
Do you think we could play sometime?
That's the idea. We can–
*ALARM*
*sigh*
Another time, perhaps...
@BATTLE
I'd say you were the surprised one.
That's true!
How are things looking out here on the bridge wing? It feels like we have a nice breeze.
It's quite beautiful and warm out here today, Captain.
Make sure the other ships are ready to head south. We need to get going to Cabo Verde.
Aye aye, Captain. The other three ships in our task force have all acknowledged on the radio that they are ready to go.
A submarine, two frigates, and us. That's it?
Not exactly an armada, but we'll do our best.

Fields.MenuText: I like your optimism, Mahan.
Don't complain. The fleet only has so many ships they can spare.
Let's start getting organized.

Fields.DialogueText: We're in charge, so we have to set the tone for the group.
I wasn't complaining... but maybe if I do a good job, my next task force will be bigger.
Aye aye, Captain.
I'm still a bit nervous about commanding the task force, though.
Being nervous is fine, as long as you stay focused. We need to be ready for–
*ALARM*
A Morgana raid! It's starting! AHHHH!
Mahan...
@BATTLE
Can I come in? It's urgent!
Of course, Mahan.
Are you all right? You look a little more... weary than I'm used to seeing you after a raid.
No, I'm not!
Are you hurt? Did the damage control teams miss something?
No, Captain. It's the rest of the task force. When the Morganas showed up, the submarine immediately went deep. Even worse, our frigates just... SAT there.
Why didn't they help us out in that fight?

Fields.MenuText: They were afraid.
We never gave them any orders.
They were caught off guard.

Fields.DialogueText: That just can't be. It must be something else.
What?
For the whole battle? That doesn't seem right.
They needed instruction, Mahan. We're the head of the task force.
I guess that means they're well-disciplined, at least.
We can't expect them to read our minds. Next time, we'll need to communicate what we expect of them.
That gives me an idea. I'm going to take care of this problem right away, Captain!
If this idea involves more typewriters...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Form One. Golf Corpen Zero Two Zero. Standby.
Execute.
Zero Two Zero, roger.
Zero Two Zero, roger.
Formation drills. Interesting.
Yes, Captain. Those two frigates are moving to position now. Their maneuvers are sharp.

Fields.MenuText: Working on fundamentals as a team. Great plan.
Isn't this a bit too... basic?
I don't think Morganas will be defeated by snappy turns.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain.
No, not at all, Captain.
Has anyone told you that your sense of humor is a bit too dry?
Soldiers march and maneuver together to work as a team. It's the same for ships.
Good point. It also gets them used to receiving and executing our commands.
And it gets me used to giving them.
Keep practicing.
I want to prove that I am up to this challenge. At sea, not just in a pile of books.
We're going to find out soon.
I... Oh. I sense them now.
And get those two frigates to help out this time!
@BATTLE
I love playing with these carved wooden chess pieces.
I'm glad we're making this a regular activity.
Me, too. I think a Belle and her captain should spend time together.
I can't argue with that. Besides, it teaches some skills we need to have as the leader of a task force.
You said this is an antique chess set from Spain. Did you get a good deal on it?

Fields.MenuText: It was a steal. Maybe the merchant didn't realize how valuable the chess set really was.
I paid a pretty penny.
Now that you mention it, maybe I could have haggled a bit more on the price.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh? I didn't realize you were such a savvy bargainer!
Some victories are worth a high price.
I've never actually haggled for anything. It seems so... intimidating.
Whatever the cost, it was worth it. I'm enjoying our games together.
Me, too, Captain. I hope we're both becoming better players.
I wonder how long it will stay quiet like this?
Oh, Captain, please don't say that...
*ALARM*
Ah, well...
@BATTLE
Some coffee, Captain? I've had so much to drink that I can't finish this pot.
Thanks.
You were typing in there for a long time, Mahan. Did you finish the orders for the task force?
I did. It summarizes our tactics, secret codes, and a full history of Morgana patrol patterns and combat behavior in this region.
A full history? How did you keep the report so brief?
That was easy. When it comes to intel on Morgana activity near Cabo Verde... there isn't any.
I was afraid of that.
It's probably why Command is sending us down there. They want someone to investigate and find out what the Morganas are doing there.
Then that's what our task force will deliver!
Let's see what you wrote.
This looks good. I'll arrange for the other captains to convene so we can brief them.
It's finally happening. We're going to do it.

Fields.MenuText: We certainly are.
Don't get cold feet.
You're going to do great.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope my training and practicing was enough.
I hope I don't.
Thanks, Captain. I needed to hear that.
Great job with the task force orders. Get some rest, but be ready for Morgana scouts.
They do seem to love harassing our little fleet out here.
@BATTLE
If you do, stick them in the water. It's going to be warm off the coast of Africa.
*ALARM*
Approaching the Cabo Verde islands...
...with our task force following us in a textbook formation. Nice work, Mahan.
Thank you, Captain.
The islands are beautiful. Keep your nose out of the newspapers and take a good look.
They are pretty. It's a shame the Morganas have to be here.
And we'll need to figure out why.
What are Morganas doing so far south? It seems so distant from most of the action.
According to Command, reconnaissance planes would sometimes spot a few Morganas heading towards this area after a major battle.
I saw those reports, too. It was strange. Any hunches, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe they're protecting something.
Maybe they get cold in the North Sea, so they come down here for vacation.
I don't think there's any reason. The Morganas seem to be everywhere.

Fields.DialogueText: That wouldn't surprise me one bit.
Morganas on vacation?! Are you joking?
Well, we have to try anyway.
Many tacticians and strategists put high value on knowing one's opponent. That's what we must do as well.
I can't argue with that.
Keep our group in tight formation, Mahan. I don't want anyone getting lost.
Aye aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I wonder if Mahan got my message.
*ALARM*
Well, I guess it will have to wait until the battle ends...
@BATTLE
Knock knock!
It's unlocked. Come on in.
I see the chessboard is set up. Ready for a game?
Of course. Take a seat.
Thanks.
Oh, here's your coffee, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: That was thoughtful of you, Mahan.
I didn't ask for coffee.
You read my mind. Thanks!

Fields.DialogueText: I've been paying attention to you. I know you like to have coffee when we play.
I know, but I noticed you like to have some when we play.
It's getting easier to do that the more time we spend together.
Ever the observant tactician, Mahan.
I do my best. Now who gets to go first today?
You can be white. I'll sip my coffee while I wait to see your strategy.
Haha! Looks like we're both observant tacticians, Captain.
You've got me there. Make your first move.
Hmm...
Captain! Captain! Please meet me over at... *gasp*... the chart table.
On my way. Mahan, take a deep breath first, THEN tell me.
Yes, of course.
Our submarine detected unusual noises along this bearing... here.
Classification?
They couldn't classify it, but they reported that it wasn't regular Morgana sounds.
Interesting.
That correlates to where one of our frigates spotted those six Morganas suddenly appearing on the horizon right about... here.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe it's a critical spot for them, and they don't want us to find it.
Maybe it's some kind of hive, where a queen is hatching more Morganas.
I honestly have no idea.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope you're right. It would explain why they keep attacking us.
That's... that's horrifying, Captain.
Me neither, Captain.
Whatever it is, it could be valuable to our superiors.
Is that good enough for Command, then? Can we go now?
Afraid not. We still need to know more about what exactly the Morganas are doing there.
*sigh* I understand, Captain.
Take our task force in for a closer look, and expect some resistance. Command is counting on us.
@BATTLE
To keep us away? Exactly.
*ALARM*
I brought us both some coffee. Ready to play some chess?
*ALARM*
I guess it will have to wait until we deal with that...
@BATTLE
Have a seat. I have a surprise for you today.
The board isn't ready yet. My side is still missing a lot of pieces.
That's the surprise.
What? I don't understand.
I want to see how you play if you don't have all of your pieces.
That's not fair!

Fields.MenuText: War isn't fair.
Are you afraid of losing?
Maybe this wasn't such a good idea.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't like this.
It's not that...
No, you're right, Captain.
I think I understand the lesson you're trying to teach me.
Which is?
Our task force is small, and in war, we might have to deal with being outnumbered by a large Morgana force. Understanding that will affect how we fight.
You figured it out right away. I guess I made my point. Want to get the rest of the pieces out and just play a regular game?
Well...
No, let's do this. I might not win, but I want to see what happens if I do my best.
That's what I hoped you would say.
Captain, your presence is requested in the bridge.
I'm here.
I've spread out our task force, with the frigates acting as picket ships, to detect when another group of Morganas appears.
You briefed this plan to me before, Mahan.
It's just that... our submarine hasn't checked in.
How long has it been since their last report?
The last time they radioed, they reported a large Morgana presence to the south. Now they're overdue by several hours, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry about it. I'm sure that submarine is fine.
Maybe they had to hide to avoid Morganas, and it isn't safe for them to surface yet.
We have to assume they're lost at sea.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not so sure, Captain. I have a terrible feeling about it.
I'm trying to be optimistic, but it feels like it's been way too long for that.
What did we do wrong?
Mahan, this might be hard to accept, but if they're gone, they're gone.
I... I must have made a mistake.
You can't start blaming yourself.
This is all my fault!
We have to keep calm.
You're... you're right. The rest of the task force is counting on us.
What do you think we should do next?
Well, the last report was to the south. We should investigate.
I agree. Let's head to their last position. Cautiously.
Aye aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Any sign of them?
The radio operator thinks she might have heard a transmission from our missing submarine, but it was too faint to be certain.
Best direction?
RDF indicates a bearing of 193.

Fields.MenuText: Then there's still hope. Steer course 193.
Maybe the submarine was warning us to stay away. Let's hold our position.
It could be a Morgana trap. We should wait for another signal.

Fields.DialogueText: Aye aye, Captain.
They might need our help. We have to move in!
Do we really have a choice, Captain?
Setting course 193
Slow us down, Mahan.
There! I think I see a periscope. It must be them. We're coming to save you!
Wait a minute. Is that fog moving in?
*ALARM*
Damn! Morganas off the port beam and the starboard beam, Captain.
Ambushed! I underestimated those Morganas.
Frigate 1 and Frigate 2, concentrate fire on port side targets.
Mahan, this is Frigate 1.
Mahan, this is Frigate 2.
We have to punch through one side before they trap us in here.
Good thinking, Mahan. I hope it's good enough.
@BATTLE
...No, I suppose not.
Captain, duck!
*BOOM*
Ouch!
That salvo hit pretty close. Are you all right, Mahan?
I saw stars that time, but I'll be all right.
We still have to get away from that Morgana force. They aren't going to stop chasing us!
I'm not sure how much longer I can keep running. I'm so... tired!
Keep the engines turning, Mahan. It's all or nothing now.
They're still on our heels. We aren't going to get away, are we?
*BOOM*
That was a big hit. Are you all right? Did one of our engines just explode?
I don't think that one hit us... It sounded like a torpedo explosion.
Look! One of the Morganas chasing us is on fire!
It's our submarine! She's ambushing the Morganas to cover our escape!
Turnabout is fair play... I was wondering when they'd show up and start shooting.
Some of the Morganas have stopped chasing us. They're splitting off to fight our sub.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think they can beat all of those Morganas?
Let's hope they can buy us enough time to escape.

Fields.DialogueText: They have a big advantage right now, but once the Morganas find her, it will get ugly.
If they cause enough confusion, we might all make it out alive.
Read the situation, Mahan.
I know, Captain, but...
The chances of the submarine making it out of this battle are slim. They're sacrificing themselves for us.
I... I understand.
Don't waste it. Keep running at full speed to the east. The rest of our task force might make it if we get through that last group of Morganas still chasing us.
Aye aye. My guns are ready, Captain.
@BATTLE
Captain, I have a request.
Do you sense any other Morganas chasing us?
No, Captain. I do not.
Our submarine ensured that the rest of our task force could get away safely.
You look upset.
My request, Captain.
What is it, Mahan?
Captain, I request that you contact Command and tell them to have me replaced as head of the task force. My tactical errors resulted in the probable loss of a submarine.

Fields.MenuText: No one would blame you for that.
You can't just give up.
Don't quit on me now. I need you.

Fields.DialogueText: But I'm the lead ship in the task force. I'm responsible for what happens.
But it feels terrible.
I'm not sure why you'd want to keep me.
This isn't like a history book about great battles and tactics, Captain. That submarine and her whole crew...
I know, but you're the ship's Belle. This is war, and sometimes, this is the price.
It hurts.
Don't give up yet. Our task force still needs a leader.
I understand.
Meet me in the radio room when you're ready. We still have a job to finish.
Aye aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain, I sense Morganas approaching!
Alert the crew. After we are done with them go to the radio room, I have to show you something.
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me in the radio room, Captain?
Have a look at this. We just finished decrypting a coded transmission from our submarine before we lost her in that ambush.
What does it say?
It says to look for a canister of film, tied to a life vest. Then there's a set of coordinates.
She must have discovered what the Morganas are doing in Cabo Verde when we lost contact!
If she took good pictures through her periscope, we need to get that intel.
Let me see those coordinates...
It's just south of where we were ambushed.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we can sprint in there and grab it before they catch us.
Maybe we can sneak in there and grab it before they spot us.
I don't see how we'll get past all of those Morganas again.

Fields.DialogueText: I have something else in mind.
Something like that. Are you reading my mind again, Captain?
I have a plan.
I'm already turning the ship around.
No time to waste. How are you going to play this one?
Frigate 1, Frigate 2, this is Mahan. Stand by for instructions.
Frigate 1
This is Frigate 2
This should be interesting...
I saw a certain look in your eye.
We're almost at the coordinates, but I don't see our frigates.
Did they get lost, Mahan?
Not at all. They drove about twenty nautical miles ahead to the west, shooting all of their guns.
A naval gunfire distraction to draw the Morganas away? Our Belle is full of clever moves.
Once their ammo's exhausted, they have orders to flee north to a rendezvous near Morocco. I don't want them getting trapped down here.
Looks like your plan's working. I don't see any Morganas yet.
Me neither, but I doubled our lookouts to keep a close eye.
Life vest spotted in the water! And there's something tied to it!
That's our submarine's gift! Let's find out what she left for us.
Uh oh. Looks like a few Morganas stayed behind. We'll have to take care of them first.
Nothing is going to stop me from getting that package!
@BATTLE
Got it! I got the package, Captain!
Nice work with that boathook, Mahan. Be careful with that canister of film.
We need to deliver this safely to Command. I hope our submarine's sacrifice was worth it.
Feeling better now?
Yes, but I'll feel a lot better when we get out of here.
My thoughts exactly. Set a course for Morocco, Mahan.
Aye aye, Captain.
Stop by my cabin later? It's been too long time since we had time for a game of chess.
You read my mind, Captain. I think we've finally earned a break.
Knight to f7. Check.
Ouch. Nice move.
Is it?
Stop teasing me, Mahan. You know it's a good move.
Don't be cross, Captain. It took a lot of hard work to get you right where I want you.
Oh? So you're saying that was all part of a big plan?
Maybe a little bit of luck, too.
Did you anticipate everything? Figure me out completely?
Just please make your next move, Captain. This game might be over soon.
You know, I haven't seen you with McNamara recently. What's he been up to?
I still spend time with him and the other officers now and then. I suppose these chess games of ours have just been taking up more of my time, recently.
You don't mind, do you?
Our chess games? Of course not, Captain! I... I like spending time with you.
I'm happy to hear it, Mahan. I like spending time with you too.
*ALARM*
In that case, that sound must be a nice surprise.
I don't just mean as a warrior, Mahan.
What do you mean?
You are a smart and talented woman, and I find those very attractive qualities.
Captain, are you saying...?
I hope you don't find this sudden or inappropriate, but I wanted to ask if you would–
Yes.
Yes?
Yes, I've never been more certain of anything. I didn't want to say anything because I thought you would stop looking at me the way you do.
I never want to stop looking at you.
Can I... can you... would a kiss... Oh my God, I'm so nervous.
Just... forget it, it was silly and we have to--
*kiss*
Oh!
*ALARM*
I hope that wasn't--
No! No... that was exactly what I needed.
We have work to do, but afterwards...
Aye-aye, Captain... afterwards...
